episode_summary: This episode of "No Such Thing As A Fish" covers a variety of intriguing topics, including the market for fake Abraham Lincoln letters, the peculiarities of remembering days of the week, legendary Vietnamese female warriors, and a rare giant squid attack on a vessel during a Jules Verne-themed race.

facts.fact: There is such a big market for fake letters by Abraham Lincoln that people have started selling fake fakes.
If you ask someone what day it is, they'll take twice as long to answer on a Wednesday as they would on a Monday or Friday.
According to Vietnamese historians, Chinese forces were once defeated by a woman who had breasts so long she had to throw them over her shoulders in battle.
One of the few incredibly rare times a giant squid has been seen attacking an ocean vessel was in 2003 when a boat was attacked while competing in the Jules Verne Trophy race.
